intro: Psilactis lepta, commonly known as the slender psilactis, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided, giving it a lacy appearance, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, Psilactis lepta is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
